Authors: Muhle-Karbe, J; Reppen, M; Soner, HM
Author Full Names: Muhle-Karbe, Johannes; Reppen, Max; Soner, H. Mete
Article Title: A Primer on Portfolio Choice with Small Transaction Costs
Source Title: ANNUAL REVIEW OF FINANCIAL ECONOMICS, VOL 9
Book Series Title: Annual Review of Financial Economics
Author Keywords: transaction costs; optimal investment and consumption; asymptotic expansions; viscosity solutions
Keywords Plus: ASYMPTOTIC ANALYSIS; OPTIMAL INVESTMENT; STOCHASTIC VOLATILITY; POLICY ITERATION; LIQUIDITY PREMIA; PENALTY METHODS; CONSUMPTION; SELECTION; HOMOGENIZATION; TIME
Abstract: This review is an introduction to asymptotic methods for portfolio choice problems with small transaction costs. We outline how to derive the corresponding dynamic programming equations and how to simplify them in the small-cost limit. This allows one to obtain explicit solutions in a wide range of settings, which we illustrate for a model with mean-reverting expected returns and proportional transaction costs. For more complex models, we present a policy iteration scheme that allows one to numerically compute the solution.

Authors: Nechaev, AS; Ognev, DV; Antipina, OV
Author Full Names: Nechaev, Andrey Sergeevich; Ognev, Dmitrii Vladimirovich; Antipina, Oksana Victorovna
Article Title: Innovation risks: challenges and prospects
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON TRENDS OF TECHNOLOGIES AND INNOVATIONS IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL STUDIES 2017
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: International Conference on Trends of Technologies and Innovations in Economic and Social Studies (TTIESS)
Author Keywords: economic growth; enterprises; innovative activity; risks
Abstract: Innovation risk is a complex multidimensional concept. To function successfully in a risk sphere, employees should have expert knowledge in economics. Effective risk management contributes to the competitiveness of a company on the domestic and international markets and increases the economic and industrial potential required for implementation of the state innovative development strategy as a whole. Innovation performance indices are the ability of operational risk management, the ability to predict innovation risks. Entrepreneurs play a coordinating role in the movement of risk management and their combinations. As a result, entrepreneurs help to establish a hierarchy of innovative connections in the real economy and economic system as a whole. The article describes the classification of risks. The article analyzes risk management methods applied in the innovation sector. It also deals with the issues of risk effects.

Article Title: The Anatomy of the CDS Market
Keywords Plus: CREDIT DEFAULT SWAPS; LOAN SALES; DERIVATIVES; RISK; LIQUIDITY; BANKING; BONDS; DEBT
Abstract: Using novel position and trading data for single-name corporate credit default swaps (CDSs), we provide evidence that CDS markets emerge as alternative trading venues serving a standardization and liquidity role. CDS positions and trading volume are larger for firms with bonds fragmented into many separate issues and with heterogeneous contractual terms. Whereas hedging motives are associated with trading volume in the bond and CDS markets, speculative trading concentrates in the CDS. Cross-market arbitrage links the CDS and bond market via the basis trade, compressing the negative CDS-bond basis and reducing price impact in the bond market.

Article Title: CHANGES IN THE CHARACTER AND COMPETITIVENESS OF UZBEKISTAN'S AGRARIAN FOREIGN TRADE
Source Title: AGRARIAN PERSPECTIVES XXVI: COMPETITIVENESS OF EUROPEAN AGRICULTURE AND FOOD SECTORS
Book Series Title: Agrarian Perspectives Series
Conference Title: 26th International Scientific Conference on Agrarian Perspectives - Competitiveness of European Agriculture and Food Sectors
Conference Location: Czech Univ Life Sci, Fac Econ & Management, Prague, CZECH REPUBLIC
Conference Host: Czech Univ Life Sci, Fac Econ & Management
Author Keywords: Agrarian trade; Uzbekistan; partners; potential; competitiveness; value; structure; changes; Export and import
Keywords Plus: 2 DECADES; COUNTRIES; CZECH
Abstract: Agricultural sector represents an important pillar in Uzbek economy and society. Agricultural trade represents nearly 10% of total merchandise exports and over 10% of total merchandise imports. The character and structure of Uzbek agrarian trade are fast changing. Only in period 1992 - 2015, the value of agrarian trade turnover increased from 140 mill. USD up to 1.7 billion USD. Changes affected not only the structure but also the value, volume, unit prices and competitiveness. The main goal of this paper is to identify the changes in the area of Uzbekistan's agrarian foreign trade structure and competitiveness. Competitiveness is analysed not only in relation to global markets, but it is also analysed in relation to different groups of countries and significant agrarian trade partners. Both agrarian trade competitiveness and territorial and commodity structure changes are analysed from the perspective of the last 15 years (2000-2015). Agrarian trade development (territorial structure) is analysed from two different perspectives: intra-trade (CIS market) and extra-trade (other countries). Competitiveness analyses is done through the application of following methods: Lafay index, Trade balance index and also the product mapping approach is applied. Uzbek agrarian trade territorial structure has become more concentrated, the commodity structure became more diversified. Uzbek trade is quite competitive especially in relation to the Asian countries and CIS countries, the competitiveness in relation to other territories is limited. The significant weakness in Uzbek agrarian trade is its ability to generate added value. The unit values of Uzbek imports are much higher in comparison to exports unit values. The main pillar of Uzbek competitiveness is low price of inputs and cheap volume of unprocessed products.

Article Title: THE IMPACT OF ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS ON REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN EASTERN ESTONIA
Source Title: NEW CHALLENGES OF ECONOMIC AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT - 2017: DIGITAL ECONOMY
Conference Title: 9th International Scientific Conference on New Challenges of Economic and Business Development - Digital Economy
Conference Sponsor: Univ Latvia, Fac Business, Management & Econ,European Commiss Representat,Latvian Informat & Commun Technol Assoc
Author Keywords: innovation; regional development; SECA regulations; smart specialisation
Keywords Plus: GROWTH; COMPETITIVENESS
Abstract: The European Parliament (EP) in 2012 established Sulphur Emission Control Areas (SECA) in Northern Europe including the Baltic Sea where ships from 2015 must not fuel with a sulphur content exceeding 0.1%w/w. Russian-Estonians have had discussions if and how these regulations impact maritime stakeholders and the economy in the Baltic Sea Region (BSR). Estonia oil shale industry is located in the Eastern part of the country (Ida-Viru County) and represents up to 5% of the national economy. Ida-Viru County is an economic weakly developed region and shares a common border with Russia with majority Russian speaking Estonians. Approximately half of regional workforce is employed directly or indirectly in this industry giving the oil shale industry an important role in the county's economic wellbeing. A large part of shale oil is used for the production of maritime bunker oil. Unfortunately, the sulphur content of shale oil is higher than it is allowed by the SECA regulations. In addition, the low oil price is putting extra pressure on oil sector which endangers the traditional business model of the Estonian oil shale industry. This paper investigates the impact of the environmental SECA regulations on the Estonian oil shale industry and discusses its consequences on the regional development as well as the economic and social cohesion in Ida-Viru County. Methodically, the research is based on expert interviews, a case study, and a further exploration of potential options to overcome possible economic distortions and to strengthen the social coherence in Eastern Estonia in the frame of the Estonian smart specialisation strategy.

Article Title: The economic cost of violent conflict: the case of Maluku province in Indonesia
Author Keywords: synthetic control method; decentralisation; conflict
Keywords Plus: REGIONAL INCOME INEQUALITY; FISCAL DECENTRALIZATION; GROWTH; WAR; IMPACT; GOVERNMENT; POVERTY; STATE
Abstract: Against the background of the socio-economic and political crises of 1998-2000 in Indonesia, one of its provinces, Maluku, endured its own internal conflicts between 1999 and 2004. The coincidence of these national and regional crisesthe tumult affecting Indonesia as a whole and the conflict restricted to Malukumake the impact of local conflict on Maluku's economy hard to identify empirically. To solve this problem, we use a synthetic control method (SCM) to construct a synthetic control unit for Maluku based on other Indonesian provinces. Our findings support the view that the violence in Maluku between 1999 and 2004 shifted the regional economy onto a lower growth path. Berlatarbelakang krisis sosial ekonomi dan politik 1998-2000 di Indonesia, salah satu provinsi, yakni Maluku, mengalami konflik internalnya sendiri antara 1999 dan 2004. Berdekatannya kedua krisis nasional dan regional ini, baik keributan yang mempengaruhi keseluruhan Indonesia maupun konflik yang terbatas di Maluku, membuat sulitnya mengidentifikasi secara empiris dampak konflik lokal pada perekonomian Maluku. Untuk mengatasi masalah ini, penulis menggunakan metode kendali sintesis (synthetic control method, SCM) untuk membangun unit kendali sintesis bagi Maluku, berdasarkan provinsi-provinsi lain di Indonesia. Temuan kami mendukung pandangan bahwa kekerasan di Maluku antara 1999 dan 2004 telah menggeser perekonomian regional ke alur pertumbuhan yang lebih rendah.

Article Title: The Fear Factor is a Main Thing: How Radio Influences Anxiety and Political Attitudes
Keywords Plus: SOUTH SUDAN; MASS-MEDIA; VIOLENCE; UGANDA; CONGO
Abstract: We investigate how being exposed to media influences levels of anxiety and political attitudes in conflict-affected areas. Exploiting exogenous variation in signal strength of a radio station in South Sudan's Western Equatoria State, we compare original qualitative and quantitative data from areas with differing radio coverage. Civilians living in areas with more exposure to radio are more afraid of attacks by the Lord's Resistance Army (LRA). This anxiety means civilians rely more on a civilian militia, the arrow boys, and less on the state army. Hence media, through fear, can contribute to changing social and political structures.

Article Title: Dragon Head Enterprises and the State of Agribusiness in China
Author Keywords: dragon head enterprise; agribusiness; global agri-food systems; China; agricultural modernization
Keywords Plus: AGRICULTURAL MODERNIZATION; AGRARIAN CHANGE; DIFFERENTIATION; CAPITALISM; DYNAMICS
Abstract: This paper examines the political trajectory of agribusiness firms called dragon head enterprises' in China's ongoing agri-food transformations. It starts from the premise that state and private elites in China are working together to consolidate a robust domestic agribusiness sector, as both an arena for national-level rural and economic development, and a new frontier for access to resources and markets abroad. Through analyses of policy documents, market share data and ethnographic materials, I explore the organization and operation of dragon heads in the pork sector. My findings reveal that agribusiness development in China's pork sector is largely domestic, has a mixed state-private form and tends to marginalize the foreign-based TNCs that have been the most powerful actors in the global agri-food system to date. I argue that China is not only a destination for external' transnational capital, but also a site of agribusiness development in its own right. This has important implications for analysing capitalist transformations and for engaging global agri-food politics.

Authors: Semenova, NN; Filippova, NA; Efremova, TA
Author Full Names: Semenova, Nadezhda Nickolaevna; Filippova, Natalya Alekseevna; Efremova, Tatyana Aleksandrovna
Article Title: Estimation of Tax Administration Efficiency in Russian Federation in context of budget tax revenues
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON TRENDS OF TECHNOLOGIES AND INNOVATIONS IN ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL STUDIES 2017
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: International Conference on Trends of Technologies and Innovations in Economic and Social Studies (TTIESS)
Author Keywords: tax administration; tax revenues; budget
Abstract: This article presents the findings of the study of tax administration efficiency in the Russian Federation in the context of tax revenue flows to the consolidated budget of the country for the period of 2005-2015. The estimation of the tax administration efficiency is based on the definition of an economic and mathematical model that characterizes the dependence of the tax revenue level on the key indicators of tax administration. The statistical data provided by the Federal Tax Service of the Russian Federation were used in the study. It has been concluded that there are three indicators that have a significant impact on the tax collection in the budget system of the Russian Federation: the amount of arrears paid; taxpayers' coverage with field tax inspections; the amount of the reduced tax payments as a result of tax inspections. The built economic and mathematical model, which confirms a relatively high correlation between the behavior of tax returns in the budget system of the Russian Federation and the selected indicators of tax administration, determines the need for its qualitative improvement in the conditions of the emerging national tax system. The article also covers recommendations for the establishment of efficient tax administration in the Russian Federation, such as: reduction in the administrative costs for enforcement of the tax legislation by state authorities and taxpayers; elimination of the existing opportunities for tax evasion; improvement of the conditions for taxpayers' performance of their tax liabilities.

Article Title: On the Translation of Government Work Report from the Perspective of Skopos Theory - A Case Study of 2016 Government Work Report

Conference Title: 2nd International Conference on Education, Management Science and Economics (ICEMSE)
Conference Sponsor: Singapore Management Univ,Xian Jiaotong Univ
Author Keywords: government work report; Skopos theory; translation strategies
Abstract: Political document is an important means to propagate the policies of the authority. Its translation quality will not only have a direct impact on the efficiency of political publicity, but also have great influence on China's image in the international community. This paper is involved with Vermeer's Skopos theory, Reiss's text typology and Nord's function plus loyalty. With an analysis of the text features of government work report, the author explores several feasible translation strategies at lexical level, syntactical level, textual level and cultural level respectively.

Article Title: Behavioral Aspects of Performance Measurement Systems in Enterprises
Source Title: NEUROECONOMIC AND BEHAVIORAL ASPECTS OF DECISION MAKING
Book Series Title: Springer Proceedings in Business and Economics
Conference Title: Conference on Computational Methods in Experimental Economics (CMEE)
Author Keywords: Performance management; Performance measurement; Social practice
Keywords Plus: MEASUREMENT IMPACTS; FIRM PERFORMANCE; SME PERFORMANCE; MANAGEMENT; FRAMEWORK
Abstract: Enterprises apply performance measurement systems to communicate their business strategy to all their employees in a clear and explicit way. For this purpose they use key success factors and key performance indicators and their assessment. Performance measurement is most efficient when it is aligned with elements such as business strategy, organizational culture and external environment. Only then does it effectively interact with the communicative processes by requiring and providing relevant information that influences the way people think, work and collaborate. The real success of the enterprise is also determined by how efficiently and effectively members of the organization use the performance information to implement the strategy. The aim of the chapter was to identify relevant behavioral aspects of constructing a performance measurement system on the one hand, and of its impact on human behavior and organizational capabilities on the other. The presented analyses are a result of a critical study of views presented in the existing large body of literature in the field of management and performance measurement.

Article Title: Economic Analysis of a Referendum
Author Keywords: wisdom of the crowds; Condorcet jury theorem; miracle of aggregation; Hong-Page theorem; paradox of voting; affect heuristic; referendum
Keywords Plus: UNDERMINES; DEMOCRACY
Abstract: The paper synthesizes the current literature regarding information aggregation, voter competence, voting paradox and behavioral economics in order to answer the question whether the phenomenon of wisdom of the crowds can be reasonably relied upon during a referendum. Review of the 'wisdom of the crowds' research reveals two key assumptions: voter competence and voter independence. Although direct testing of the actual fulfillment of these assumptions in a real-world setting is not possible, both empirical literature on voting behavior and rational choice theory provide ample ground for skepticism in this regard. Low level of knowledge together with unmitigated influence of systematic biases is expected to dominate the actual voting behavior. Affect heuristic is used as an example to illustrate this point. The paper concludes that referendum does not seem to be a reliable way to revealing preferences regarding various social issues.

Article Title: When an Auto Industry Disappears: Australia's Experience and Lessons for Canada
Author Keywords: automotive manufacturing; Canada; Australia; deindustrialization
Abstract: All three global automakers currently manufacturing vehicles in Australia have announced their total shutdown of operations there by 2017. This shutdown has sparked some fears that Canadian auto manufacturing may follow a similar trajectory. This article reviews the factors contributing to the closures in Australia and considers key structural, economic, and policy differences between the Australian and Canadian cases. The Canadian industry enjoys several structural advantages compared with Australia, chief among them its large and bilateral trade relationship with the United States. These advantages suggest that the Canadian industry has a better prognosis.

Authors: Taneo, SYM; Setiyati, EA; Meany; Hadiati, S
Book Editors: Munizu, M; Zamhuri, MY; Shunsuke, R; Pagalung, G; Alexander, M; Chamberlain, S; Nohong, M
Author Full Names: Taneo, Stefanus Yufra M.; Setiyati, Etsa Astridya; Meany; Hadiati, Sri
Article Title: Tapping the Potential of Processed Food Production Based Small and Medium Enterprises as Economic Drivers in Malang Regency
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2ND INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ACCOUNTING, MANAGEMENT, AND ECONOMICS 2017 (ICAME 2017)
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: 2nd International Conference on Accounting, Management, and Economics (ICAME)
Author Keywords: SMEs; LQ; commodity base; processed food; Malang
Abstract: Food Processing Industry gives the biggest contribution to Gross Regional Domestic Product (PDRB) of Malang Regency during 2010 until 2014; but unfortunately, it has not developed optimally yet, especially to increase the income of small and medium entrepreneurs. This study aims to (1) identify the types of production based SMEs within this industry which are potential to drive the economy of the District in Malang Regency, and (2) investigate the factors which may affect the production of these SMEs. Data were obtained from the Industry and Commerce Department of Malang Regency. Location Quotient (LQ) analysis tool was employed to identify the type of food production based SMEs that are potential to become the driving force for the regional economy. In addition, multiple linear regression was used to determine the effect of the amount of labor, equipment investment, and raw material costs on the production of processed food types. The results of the identification find that there are three types of food production based SMEs (that are generated by most of 33 districts in Malang Regency), namely (1) bread and pastries, (2) chips, and (3) crackers. The result of LQ analysis shows that bread and pastry SMEs become the economic driver in Dau, Gedangan, Singosari, Sumberpucung, Wagir, and Wajak subdistricts. Chips SMEs become the economic driver in Ampelgading, Pagelaran, Pakis, Tirtoyudo, Turen and Wajak subdistricts. Meanwhile, Crackers SMEs become the economic driver in Bululawang, Donomulyo, Sumbermanjing Wetan, Turen, and Wajak subdistricts. From the perspective of equity aspect in economic development, the findings of this research is deemed to be interesting, because it shows that most sub-districts whose food production based SMEs become the economic driver are located in South Malang (except Singosari, Dau, and Pakis subdistricts) in which economic condition of the people is lower than that of the rest of Malang Regency.

Authors: Torp, A; Andrei, AG; Purcarea, AA
Book Editors: Pinzaru, F; Zbuchea, A; Bratianu, C; Vatamanescu, EM; Mitan, A
Author Full Names: Torp, Andronicus; Andrei, Andreia Gabriela; Purcarea, Anca Alexandra
Article Title: THE RELATION BETWEEN AN EMPLOYEE'S ENERGY PROFILE AND THEIR PROFESSIONAL PERFORMANCE
Source Title: STRATEGICA: SHIFT! MAJOR CHALLENGES OF TODAY'S ECONOMY
Book Series Title: Strategica
Conference Title: 5th International Academic Conference on Strategica - Shift! Major Challenges of Today's Economy
Conference Sponsor: Natl Univ Polit Studies & Publ Adm, Fac Management,Natl Bank Romania
Author Keywords: human resource management; electrophotonic imaging; stress; energy; performance; HR assessment
Abstract: The present paper is a trans-disciplinary study examining the relation between the energy profile of a person and his/her professional performance. It is based on an empirical study conducted within a large multi-national shipping company whose employees had their energy profile assessed on a monthly basis for more than a year. All measurements were done using Korotkov's Electrophotonic Imaging Device. These measurements were then correlated with selected performance data from the company related to each employee: turnover, profit, and number of transports. The results of the study have shown that it is possible to make valid predictions regarding an employee's future performance based on that person's energy profile, at least in certain areas. It was found that measured levels of employee's energy and stress, assessed with the Electrophotonic Imaging Device, are valid predictors of the turnover and the number of transports generated by the respective employee. In this way, the connection between an employee's energy profile and their professional performance becomes clear. This can then be used to make objective and quantitative assessments about the future professional performance, not just of the assessed employee, but of other employees as well, because the proposed approach is based on universal principles and not on subjective evaluations. This research offers valuable information for both academia and practice, indicating a new way of predicting working performance that can be immediately used by companies to enhance staff performance and human resource management.

Article Title: Fourier Expansion Method on Cumulative Distribution Function and Value-at-Risk Estimate
Source Title: INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ECONOMICS, MANAGEMENT ENGINEERING AND MARKETING (EMEM 2017)
Book Series Title: DEStech Transactions on Economics Business and Management
Conference Title: 2017 International Conference on Economics, Management Engineering and Marketing (EMEM)
Author Keywords: Value-at-Risk; Log-Stable Uncertainty; Fourier-series Expansion
Keywords Plus: SPECULATIVE PRICES; MARKET
Abstract: This paper proposes a Fourier-series based method to estimate the cumulative distribution function (cdf) of random variables that follow levy process. Since most cdf(s) of levy process do not have explicit forms but their characteristic functions are always available. Our method approaches a cdf by the Fourier-series and the coefficients are only determined by the characteristic function. Therefore, our method can be widely used in the levy process without any difficulty. Finally, we apply this method to calculate the Value-at-Risk (VaR) of a portfolio that the constituents follow the stable distribution with or without identical characteristic exponents (alpha).

Article Title: Research on Beijing Industrial Energy Efficiency under Industry Updating and Transfer
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2017 2ND INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON FINANCIAL INNOVATION AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (ICFIED 2017)
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: 2nd International Conference on Financial Innovation and Economic Development (ICFIED)
Author Keywords: Industry upgrading and transfer; Industrial energy efficiency; DEA-Malmquist model; System cluster analysis
Keywords Plus: SECTOR
Abstract: Industry upgrading and transfer is an important way of the industry collaborative optimization in Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei, and the research on energy efficiency has important practical significance in the process of industrial transfer and upgrading. Based on the capital, labor and energy consumption as input indicators, industrial added value as the expected output indicator, carbon dioxide emissions as the unexpected output indicator, this paper uses the DEA-Malmquist model to measure total factor energy efficiency of Beijing, including 36 sub-industrial sectors and they are divided into high, medium and low energy efficiency industry by using the system cluster analysis. Then we calculate the total factor energy efficiency index and its decomposition index of Beijing industry in 2005-2013. The empirical analysis draws that the overall industrial energy efficiency shows an upward trend. And the technological progress is the main driving factor and the difference of pure technical efficiency is the main reason for the gap among the industries.

Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2017 2ND INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON EDUCATION, MANAGEMENT SCIENCE AND ECONOMICS (ICEMSE 2017)

Abstract: Energy conservation and environmental protection industry, as an important part of the green industry, is the major fostered project for China in recent years, meanwhile, it is also one of the most potential industry in the 21st century. Energy conservation and environmental protection project mainly includes the technical equipment, products and services, etc., besides, these environmental protection projects have the characteristics of long industrial chain, high degree of association, strong employment absorption capacity, etc. In this paper, taking Jilin province as an example and through analyzing the energy conservation and emissions reduction situation of the listed enterprises in China, The method of empirical research is adopted, it takes detail study of the performance review and quota allocation of the listed enterprises in China so that to effectively relieve the resources issue facing by China's economic and social development and promote the transformation of original and vulgar economic development pattern, finally drive China's economic growth through the research.

Article Title: Food safety and food imports in Europe: the risk of aflatoxins in pistachios
Source Title: INTERNATIONAL FOOD AND AGRIBUSINESS MANAGEMENT REVIEW
Author Keywords: pistachio; tree nut; aflatoxin; food safety; trade
Keywords Plus: DEMAND; IMPACT; TRADE
Abstract: The United States has surpassed Iran as the largest pistachio exporter to the European Union. Both lower prices and a less frequency of aflatoxin contamination have contributed to the success of the US pistachio industry. Using EU monthly imports and food safety alerts data, we estimate EU demand for US and Iranian pistachios. We find that EU demand for US pistachios is price-inelastic but the demand for Iranian pistachios is price-elastic. We also find that the income effect is positive for US nuts but negative for Iranian nuts. Most importantly, we find that EU imports of US pistachios decrease with aflatoxin alerts traced back to the US but increase with contamination incidents originated from Iran.

Article Title: English Professional Curriculum Reform from the Perspective of Students' Needs under the Background of Socialization of NMET
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2017 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON EDUCATION AND MANAGEMENT (ICEM 2017)
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: 7th International Conference on Education and Management (ICEM)
Author Keywords: Socialization of NMET; Students' needs; English professional curriculum reform
Abstract: Under the background of socialization of NMET, college English major courses also need to adjusted to a certain degree. To meet students' needs, universities should add in appreciation courses to cultivate students' innovation and enhance students' ability of listening and speaking. On teachers' guidance work, teachers should arouse students' enthusiasm in class, inspire students' divergent thinking and strengthen students' self-confidence. Use the reform of college English professional courses to cope with the changes of the social needs of the reform of socialization of NMET in order to cultivate talents with comprehensive ability so that they can better serve the society and meet the needs of the society. Since the implementation of the college entrance examination system, according to China's actual national conditions and personnel training, in constant exploration and study, in order to improve examinees comprehensive quality and improve China's comprehensive national strength, our country has been in constant reform of college entrance examination system. In recent years, much attention has been paid to English college entrance examination system. In the third plenary session of the communist party of China 18, the suggestion is that we should explore English university entrance exam for social tests. Social examination refers to students from the school system, through social institutions to participate in the examination. They can take an examination of more in order to get the best result which is included in the university entrance exam grades. The system reform is both an opportunity and a challenge for college English teaching and development. Under the background of socialization of NMET, university English major curriculum not only needs keeping pace with the times, to a certain reform, but also meets students' needs[1]. To really implement this, we must be from students' perspective to explore and analyze their potential advantages and disadvantages in the face of socialization of NMET[2]. Through a certain curriculum adjustment, cultivate new talents with all-round development so as to meet social demands[3].

Article Title: Innovation of Private Customized Tourism Development Mode under the Tourism E-Commerce Platform
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2017 2ND INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON EDUCATION, MANAGEMENT SCIENCE AND ECONOMICS (ICEMSE 2017)
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: 2nd International Conference on Education, Management Science and Economics (ICEMSE)
Conference Sponsor: Singapore Management Univ,Xian Jiaotong Univ
Author Keywords: tourism e-commerce platform; private customized tourism; development mode; sustainable development
Abstract: With the improvement of people's living standards and the promotion of their economic income, traveling outside has already become one of the main activities in people's leisure and entertainment time. Facing the increasing demands of the tourism market, the traditional mass tourism has been unable to satisfy the curiosity and satisfaction of modern tourists. For these reasons, the online private customized tourism has come into being. According to the different needs of tourists and their different consumption levels, tourism industries have developed different types of tourism experience projects and put them on tourism websites to meet the tourists' needs. In this way, visitors will be able to choose their own tourism projects through the Internet. The online private customized tourism has the characteristics of individualization, specialization, convenient and efficient, and strong pertinence. It can arouse the enthusiasm of tourists on tourism. In this way, it can realize the sustainable development in tourism industry sequentially.

Abstract: Based on analyzing basic conditions and status quo of modern logistics development at HY County, this article conducts prediction on the demand for logistics through GA-BP neural network model so as to determine the land size of the logistics park, providing references for the construction and development of the logistics park in the county.

Article Title: On Improving the Effect of the Probity Education for College Students in the Practice of Poverty Alleviation
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2017 2ND INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON EDUCATION, MANAGEMENT SCIENCE AND ECONOMICS (ICEMSE 2017)
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: 2nd International Conference on Education, Management Science and Economics (ICEMSE)
Conference Sponsor: Singapore Management Univ,Xian Jiaotong Univ
Author Keywords: college students; probity education; actual effect; poverty alleviation; practice
Abstract: It is necessary to improve the actual effect of the education, so that most of the students who receive probity education can remain clean after graduation. For this reason, it should be emphasized that the key is not abstract theory, but experiential practice. We can try to make students accept probity education in poverty alleviation practice. Appropriate practical identities should be given to college students in the practice. Each college student can get the guidance of the appointed three teachers. The three teachers include a staff member of research institutions of anti-corruption in colleges, a poverty alleviation agency staff and a supervisory agency staff. The students should formulate the education plan and implement it under the guidance of the three teachers. The most important thing in the plan is to make clear the tasks. The tasks are cultivating clean values, enriching honest knowledge, and training anti-corruption skills.

Article Title: Analysis of University Activities in PCT Patent Application
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 21ST INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE CURRENT TRENDS IN PUBLIC SECTOR RESEARCH

Conference Title: 21st International Conference ON Current Trends in Public Sector Research

Author Keywords: technology transfer office; university patenting; commercialization potential; patent cooperation treaty; patent
Abstract: Universities contribute to economic growth not only through teaching and research, but through engagement and collaborations with industry and other off campus entities. One way of measuring the economic effects of these activities is to examine patent data. The aim of the study is to introduce analysis of university activities. If technology transfer office manager determines that an invention has sufficient internationally commercial potential, university will probably choose to file a Patent Cooperation Treaty (PCT) application on an invention. This study evaluates commercial potential of university patenting through participation of PCT application.

Article Title: Research on the Influence of Perceiving Other Customer Support on Customer Citizenship Behavior
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2017 7TH INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON EDUCATION AND MANAGEMENT (ICEM 2017)
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: 7th International Conference on Education and Management (ICEM)
Author Keywords: Perceiving other customer support; Customer commitment; Customer citizenship behavior
Keywords Plus: QUALITY; LOYALTY
Abstract: Customer citizenship behavior has a very good promotion effect on the enterprise operation. However, the past researches paid little attention to the influence of other customers. From the consumption scenario, the support of other customers will be closer to the actual consumer and increases the validity of the conclusions of the study. This study attempts to use customer commitment as an intermediary variable to explore the impact of perceiving the support of other customers on customer citizenship behavior. Through questionnaire surveys of clothing store customers, it is considered that perceiving other customer support has a significant positive impact on customer citizenship behavior and customer commitment plays an intermediary role.

Article Title: Research on Precision Marketing Strategy in Big Data Era
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 2017 2ND INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON FINANCIAL INNOVATION AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT (ICFIED 2017)
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: 2nd International Conference on Financial Innovation and Economic Development (ICFIED)
Author Keywords: Big data; Data analysis; Model building; Precision marketing
Abstract: With the development of e-commerce and the rise of big database analysis, enterprises pay more and more attention to big data marketing. This paper discusses the basic process and content of big data marketing from several aspects, such as data collection, data analysis and model construction, precision marketing application based on big data. Some precision marketing strategies concerning customer segmentation, personalized product recommendation, precision marketing information dissemination, market forecast and brand communication are put forward.

Authors: Zhang, Y; Qian, ZW; Li, YX
Author Full Names: Zhang Yan; Qian Zhenwei; Li Yunxian
Article Title: Assessment of Compensation Ability of Agricultural Catastrophe Insurance in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF 2017 CHINA INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON INSURANCE AND RISK MANAGEMENT
Conference Title: 8th China International Conference on Insurance and Risk Management (CICIRM)
Conference Location: Guilin Univ Technol, Sch Management, Guilin, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Tsinghua Univ Sch Econ & Management, China Ctr Insurance & Risk Management,City Univ London, Cass Business Sch
Author Keywords: Agriculture insurance; Catastrophe losses; Assessment
Abstract: Agricultural catastrophe loss compensation ability is institutional constraints to agricultural catastrophe insurance system. Facing the agricultural insurance catastrophe risk, how much compensation can our insurance market provide? So we should simulate the agricultural catastrophe loss compensation ability evaluation by building the agricultural insurance market catastrophe loss compensation ability measurement model. The results show that based on the principle of guaranteed materialized cost and in a complete coverage of agricultural risks, in the face of 40 billion lost on average, the whole insurance market can provide about 20 billion, and the compensation ability is only 50%. The huge gap calls the government to give more financial support.

Authors: Zhao, L; Qian, JR; Xu, L
Author Full Names: Zhao Liang; Qian Jiarong; Xu Lei
Article Title: Imported Risk Analysis of Rice Based on Countries in China
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF 2017 CHINA INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON INSURANCE AND RISK MANAGEMENT
Conference Title: 8th China International Conference on Insurance and Risk Management (CICIRM)
Conference Location: Guilin Univ Technol, Sch Management, Guilin, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Tsinghua Univ Sch Econ & Management, China Ctr Insurance & Risk Management,City Univ London, Cass Business Sch
Author Keywords: Rice Imports Fluctuation Risks
Abstract: The quantities of imported rice were increasing recent years. as one of the important food, rice importing is facing volatility risk. This paper analyzes the current situation of rice imports, the concentration of countries, trends and characteristics and definite the import risk and classification of rice as while as build a model analyze the impact of imported fluctuations on China quantitatively. Then establish probability density function of different countries and compare the degree of fluctuations. The main conclusions are: the import concentrations of countries and geography are both high facing systemic risks; total imports and fitting functions from different countries are different; empirical results show that the fluctuations of rice imports will stabilize due to importing from Myanmar and Laos; there are different probability density fluctuations among Laos, Vietnam and Thailand of rice import and there are differences about the fluctuation range and occurrence probability.

Article Title: Path Analysis of LPO Process Pooling Model under the Perspective of Internet Plus
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ECONOMICS, MANAGEMENT, LAW AND EDUCATION (EMLE 2017)
Book Series Title: AEBMR-Advances in Economics Business and Management Research
Conference Title: 3rd International Conference on Economics, Management, Law and Education (EMLE)
Conference Sponsor: Int Sci & Culture Ctr Acad Contacts,Henan Univ Minsheng Coll,Zhengzhou Yingchun Conf Planning Co Ltd
Author Keywords: legal process outsourcing (LPO); one-stop integrated legal services; legal cost analysis; contract life cycle management
Abstract: With the advancement of China's the Belt and Road Initiatives, Going out Strategies of Chinese enterprises has spawned many multinational enterprises and cross - border projects, and the demand for legal services has also increased rapidly. Whether the Legal counsel, wind control department of enterprises or law firm, if you want to exploit the new markets in this round of supply side reform wave, efficiency, cost control and globalization will become the focus. Achieving these goals will require continuous exploration of new legal services, while legal process outsourcing (LPO) will become the most effective means of cross-border legal services. This paper attempts to analyze the cooperation between LPO service providers and Chinese and foreign law firms from the relevant theories of LPO service in order to find out the path of Chinese law firms to participate in LPO outsourcing business.

Article Title: The Effect of Mortality on Life Insurance Products' Profit
Source Title: PROCEEDINGS OF 2017 CHINA INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON INSURANCE AND RISK MANAGEMENT
Conference Title: 8th China International Conference on Insurance and Risk Management (CICIRM)
Conference Location: Guilin Univ Technol, Sch Management, Guilin, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Tsinghua Univ Sch Econ & Management, China Ctr Insurance & Risk Management,City Univ London, Cass Business Sch
Author Keywords: mortality; mortality risk; product profit; lapse rate
Abstract: We have to consider a lot of assumptions in the process of the development of life insurance products, and surplus would change from year to year under given sets of assumptions one of which is mortality. As the economic level has been greatly improved these years, the mortality rate is gradually declining as a whole. The change will affect the premiums, reserves and moreover, the profits of the life insurance products for the mortality rate is of great importance in the design of life insurance products. Thus the effect of the mortality has become one of the problems we have to think seriously. In December 21, 2016, China Insurance Regulatory Commission issued the Notice on the Use of 2010-2013 Life Table, published the China's Life Insurance Industry Life Table (2010-2013), and that insurance companies can refer to the data provided in the  China's Life Insurance Industry Life Table (2010-2013) in the determination of insurance premiums as a basis for deciding the predetermined mortality. In practice, the change in mortality, in addition to itself, will also lead to changes in other indicators, such as lapse rate, sales, and so forth; and different insurance products are affected by mortality rate to various extent, such as life insurance and annuities. This paper will use life insurance and annuities to explore the impact of mortality on the overall profit under the basis that other conditions remain unchanged, which, use the idea that profit equals net cash flow minus incremental liabilities for references. In order to explore the impact of mortality on the overall profit of different insurance products, the research will include the contents shown below. To the beginning, this paper will use stochastic simulation to work out the future mortality improvement factor from different aspects based on the newly published experience life table. Subsequently, we take the lapse rate into account to estimate the change of lapse rate according to the fluctuation of mortality. Then we set a group of term insurance and term annuity to determine the annual profit and cumulative earnings based on series of fundamental hypothesis. Finally, this article will provide some suggestions for the operation in practice according to the results obtained above. The mortality changes have long been problems of concern, and it also has some research value in this paper if we examine this problem from new perspective. One is that in the profit measurement process, this paper aims at the overall profit of the product, examines the different kinds of mortality risk and its impact on the lapse rate, so that the situation in profit measurement is more diversified. For another thing, using the insurance product portfolio as the research object, this research will observe the comprehensive impact caused by mortality rate of the different types of insurance, which is closer to the reality of the insurance market situation. And the proposed risk management recommendations may provide references for the actual operation of the insurance company.

Abstract: The article studies the issues of regional agroindustrial integration in the context of a single network structure formation, which brings together the sectors of supply, production and sales, industrial, trade, marketing, research, consulting and other organizations directly involved in the process of production of competitive agricultural product, and bringing it to the consumer. Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Innovative Management and Priorities of Urban Policies
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: city; sustainability; innovative management; urban policy; architectural regeneration; efficacy
Abstract: The paper presents priorities of urban policies in relation to innovative management and the strengths of this kind of strategic approach. In fact, urban policies are policies for managing the cities and the urban as a way of being. They define the planning benchmarks and directions for the sustainable development of the urban area. Cities are made up of several components/sub-systems on which sectoral policies focus (e.g., demographic, social, municipal, cultural, environmental). Therefore, at the city level, we speak about a mix of urban policies and not one policy. A priority of urban policies is the regeneration of municipal heritage, especially of the architectural heritage - of iconic buildings - as symbols of collective memory. The European cities which signed the Leipzig Charter undertake projects to effectively regenerate and use the architectural heritage as a development axis. Also, it is very necessary to create and value public spaces - elements of the urban framework - as places bearing value and symbols required for creatively living together. Culture is another priority of the urban policy. Studying the relation between culture and city regeneration provides several benchmarks for formulating public policies and ensuring economic sustainability of the urban world. The entire dynamics of the urban area - from the municipal policy to the development of a creative economy and high technology acquisition leave their mark on cultural policies, on their targets and functions. The assessment of the outcome of the innovative activity reveals the managerial efficiency in its multidimensionality: material, environmental, cultural, economic, institutional, etc.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Mathematical Models for the Assessment of Collapse in Oil Prices
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: GARCH Models; Volatility; Generalized hyperbolic distribution; Time Series
Keywords Plus: VOLATILITY
Abstract: The methods addressing volatility in computational finance and econometrics have received considerable attention since the introduction of ARCH, first studied by Engle (Engle, 1982) and its generalization, the GARCH models by Bollerslev (Bollerslev, 1986). The Generalized hyperbolic distribution (Ghyp) was introduced into the literature by Barndorff-Nielsen (Barndorff, 1997). The application of this distribution in financial market price process have been used significantly. In this paper we consider European Brent Crude Oil returns from the period 1987-2008. We have implemented GARCH modeling and Ghyp distribution with its types for underlying return series.

Authors: Voica, C; Panait, M; Ene, C
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Voica, Catalin; Panait, Mirela; Ene, Corina
Article Title: The Capital Market's Actors and Financial Education. The Romanian Case
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: financial education; stock exchanges; financial supervisory authority; consumers; investors
Keywords Plus: LITERACY
Abstract: The international crisis revealed that the financial world was so complex that even qualified investors and rating agencies could hardly properly evaluate the financial products, especially the new ones that are very complex and sophisticated. The article is focused on the importance of financial education for capital market consumers/investors who must acquire specific skills. This is the first step that leads to financial literacy and the final result is an adequate financial behavior of investors. Even the consumers from the developed countries face the lack of financial literacy, but in former communist countries, the level of financial education is very low. The consequences of the lack of financial literacy are long-term, and the wellbeing of consumers is affected. Therefore, the financial consumers must be helped to become more resilient. Public authorities like financial supervisory authorities and institutions like stock exchanges could support this by improving financial regulation and consumer protection frameworks and promoting suitable financial products. The authors analyzed the activities of the capital market's institutions from Romania and proposed specific measures in order to improve the financial education of the investors.

Article Title: New Results on Creating Virtual Exhibitions in the Cultural Sector
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: virtual exhibitions; cultural heritage; mobile technologies; digitization
Abstract: The paper presents new research results achieved in the development of virtual exhibitions in cultural institutions. The economic aspects of virtual exhibitions implementation are presented in order to highlight the benefits of these applications to cultural institutions. The role of virtual exhibitions in the promotion of cultural heritage collections is described. The key aspects of development process of virtual exhibitions are revealed using dedicated tools and programming languages. The paper describes the most recent implementations of virtual exhibitions, created with a dedicated software available at the Romanian Academy Library. A study is conducted on a virtual exhibition in order to measure the user experience and user behavior in the application.

Authors: Dumitrescu, GC; Moagar-Poladian, S; Tanase, IA
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Dumitrescu, George-Cornel; Moagar-Poladian, Simona; Tanase, Ion-Alexandru
Article Title: The Relations Between the USA and the Main Actors in East Asia from the Perspective of the New American Leadership
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Trump; Asia; China; India; TPP
Abstract: Donald Trump's election as president of the United States of America has caused a moment of suspense, the major global actors waiting to see to what extent his declared intentions as a candidate will coincide with the concrete actions dictated by the president. Our work aims to assess the priorities on the presidential agenda towards East Asia, and the reactions of America's key allies and competitors in the region to it, in order to identify the new trends in the relations among the world's greatest powers. The analysis is based primarily on the published literature, the official positions of the main stakeholders and relevant databases of international institutions.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Towards a European Youth Well-being Index
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: young people; life quality; European Union
Abstract: Becoming more aware of the serious demographic problems, researchers, experts, media and national and international institutions focus on finding and minimizing the shortcomings in the lives of specific categories of individuals. There are global indexes regarding old age and youth, but the EU has not yet built such specific indexes. At present, Europe is still going through an important social, political and economic crisis and the young people from Europe are affected by high levels of unemployment, poverty and social exclusion. Though the EU programs, initiatives and financing schemes seem to outline the general framework of action and the EU has some specific targets for young people, the major positive results are not very evident. At the worldwide level, there is a Global Youth Wellbeing Index and a Global Youth Development Index and, at the European level, there are numerous indicators to highlight the situation and well-being of young people but there is no general index to synthesize these indicators. Therefore, this article tries to emphasize the necessity of such an index at the European Level and to offer some suggestions regarding its construction.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Coordinates of Urban Culture in the Context of Sustainable Development of the Cities
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: town; sustainable development; architectural heritage; urban culture; social inclusion; participation; urban consciousness; creativeness
Abstract: The paper deals with definitions of urban culture in relation to various fields: town planning, architecture, anthropology, urban sociology, cultural management. The coordinates of urban culture - in the context of (economic, technological, social, ecological and cultural) integrated urban development - depend on the local context, the typology of cities and communities. Our research work deals with urban culture coordinates in large cities, where social polarization and economic stratification as well as the contrasting ways of living and mentalities are more obvious. Moreover, in cities we find most of the cultural institutions and creative industry organizations - spaces for creating the cultural contents and behavioral rules able to reshape the urbanity model. But there are problems concerning urban culture in localities lacking in economic units, resources, and productive businesses towns which we could define by the well-known phrase places where nothing happens.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Ciutacu, Otilia Teodora; Gaf-Deac, Ioan I.
Article Title: Normative Economy and Interventionist Policies to Achieve Efficiency in the Field of Natural Resources
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: normative economics; interventionist politics; producer; consumer; taxes; natural resources
Abstract: The exploitation and utilization of natural resources is desirable conduct scientifically and objectively. In this framework, normative economics provides specific methods and ways of operation. Using the best economic methods is only hypothetical, since the course of practical operation and recovery process just tends to be increasingly more representative, according to one method or another. Normative economy of natural resources leads to economic positivity accepted in conventional production and reproduction. In the space of normative economics, value manifests parametrically. Relativity of variation in size of value of resources and goods is given, for example, by increasing taxes to achieve controlled distribution and to encourage or discourage consumption, or by minimizing taxes, when we intend to create conditions to encourage a certain type of consumption. Normative economics is demanding answers to questions concerning what to produce with certain resources at our disposal;' how to produce those products and for whom to produce (who consumes). In such a situation, it requires knowledge and understanding of the functionality of markets in competition. It is also necessary to identify the balance and efficiency of resources under transformation by understanding the differences in the markets in which we can operate with a set of interventions to ensure procedural efficiency.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Financing the EU Agricultural Sector through Direct Payments: Implications of the CAP Reform
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Common Agricultural Policy; Direct Payments; EU Agricultural Sector
Abstract: The latest reform of the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP) has had a substantial impact on the financing tools of the agricultural sector in the EU Member States. Currently, the most used mechanism for financing agriculture in the European area is represented by the direct payments that constitute an instrument for supporting the European farmers and sustainable rural development in the EU. In this context, our paper aims to assess through a quantitative analysis the financial allocations for direct payments in the member states, and also to underline existing opportunities for Romania using a qualitative analysis as revealed by the current financial framework (2014-2020). For this purpose, we use DG Agriculture & Rural development statistics, and country sheets available in the European Commission database. Our analysis will be supported by the most relevant theoretical approaches in the literature in the field, but also by the latest European Commission reports on CAP reforms. In the final part of our research we will highlight through a quantitative analysis the CAP reform impact on direct payments but also on the sustainability of agricultural practices in the member states.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Central Banks' Forecasts - An Orientation Tool for the Public and the Financial Markets
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Macroeconomic forecast; central banks; financial markets
Abstract: In the area of macroeconomic forecasts, central banks have at all times been in the forefront, but the manner in which they develop and dispose the forecasts has changed a lot over the last decades. Changes emerged that reflect evolutions in economic theory, as well in the monetary policy strategies adopted over time. Publishing their own forecasts may take the form of a self-discipline imposed by central banks, coming (or not) to support the credibility of central banks in meeting their objectives. According to recent studies, forecasts made by central banks influence the forecasts of the private sector and monetary policy means more than private expectations management, which is a subtle channel of monetary policy transmission. The issue regarding the central bank forecasting can be seen from two perspectives: development of forecasts, on the one hand, and their communication (public broadcasting), on the other. In relation to the financial markets, the second perspective is dominant-how to communicate forecasts and their impact on financial markets, based on the influence of financial variables.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Contributions to the Development of A Hierarchical Model of Human Resources Management
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: hierarchy; management; model; subordination
Abstract: The history of management thinking and practice highlights the existence of a consistent package of hierarchical marks that justify the effort of patterning a human resources' management. The analysis of the subordination relation regarded as a connection that generates the hierarchy, reveals its functional character, the pyramidal ordering principle of elements in the field of economic structures, being not only a result of methodological demands of scientific order, but also a demand of accomplishment of the administration of these systems. Practically, the hierarchy defines exactly the system's structure, the relatively invariant aspect of it, through which all the other attributes of managerial architecture are externalized: integrality, homeostasis, self-structuring, hierarchy, self-generation and development. Without denying the natural variability of managerial hierarchies, imposed by the complexity of the economic-social domain where it is manifest, we will demonstrate that the three elements that support this model stability, namely convergence, functionality and adaptability, offer it a quasi-general applicability.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Recent Developments in the Process of Consolidating Democracy in Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: politics; political parties; democracy; democracy consolidation
Abstract: My intention in this paper is furthering the previous approaches to analyzing democracy and its consolidation in Romania after the collapse of the communist regime by the Revolution of December 1989. Those events were accompanied by the loss of human lives to open the way toward a new political path for Romania, with multiple effects on the lives of individuals. Actions for institutional building have been undertaken for more than a third of the century; a new constitution was adopted (1991) which stipulated the democratic regime, republican governance, fundamental rights and freedoms, as well as the duties of citizens, public authorities, etc. Local, parliamentary and presidential elections were held, extending to the European Parliament (after Romania's accession to the European Union in 2007) as well. At the same time, several national referenda were held. Approaching such a topic is justified by the fact that the progress recorded at any given time is not set in stone; the situation develops, and deviations might occur, so that it is important to acknowledge all changes and their effects within the society. For the entire mentioned time interval, it might be appreciated that, as shown in the SWOT analysis, the democratic political regime was maintained and upheld, despite some failures along the way. The Romanian political scene was dominated by two directions, i.e. the social-democratic one (the Social-Democrat Party), and the liberal one (the Democrat-Liberal Party and the National Liberal Party, currently unified under the name of the latter), without any of these parties having absolute majority, save for the elections of May 1990. Therefore, government coalitions were built with consistent majorities, based on the temporary collaboration of the two major orientations. As an EU and NATO member, the potential for the development of the country increases considerably, along with the opportunities for strengthening democracy, but this needs to be valued adequately, promoting actions designed to counteract all domestic dysfunctions related to public institutions, the efficient and high use of resources, eradication of corruption, etc. At the same time, it is necessary to pay more attention to improving the living conditions of the population, this being also a favorable factor for the functioning of the democracy, if it is accompanied by the support of the citizens and adequate government.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Food Citizenship and Community Gardens. A Case Study in Italy
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Sustainability; social inclusion; local governance; municipal incentives
Keywords Plus: SPACE; CITY
Abstract: The study highlights the practice of urban agriculture, especially community gardens. Using qualitative methods, this investigation aimed to gain an understanding of how a community garden may facilitate social capital stocks of members. An example as case study is the municipality of Catania, in the South of Italy, an urban context characterized by few public green spaces. The finding is that gardens are places where both attitudes and practices can change in the process of engagements of the citizens. In a world where questions of sustainability are increasingly driven by cities and their residents, the community gardens help identify areas of social and transformative food potential as well as concern.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Socio-Economic Support Granted to Elderly People from Romania at Present and in the Future
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: elderly people; public pension system; security system; social policies
Abstract: The fact that the current public policy regarding the pension system does not compensate for the lack of vision in tackling demographic problems and lack of willingness to financially support the public system, the problem of anti-advertising among young generations, although 60-80% of their pension will come from the public system, is the main issue of this paper. Patterns of consumption and saving are in rapid change. Jobs in the economic field which produce wealth are highly fluctuating. Romania is a small economy, heavily exposed to international changes. As a consequence, pillar I still faces the unpredictability of policies in the decades to come. It's difficult to professionally consider longer term developments (4-5 years), due to the high speed of change in economic, social and political fields. Building a political will for maintaining the public pension system is essential for massively increasing the quality of life for both the elderly and the young generations through the extended families.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: The Quality of Life in Romania and Ethics of Social Action
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Quality of life; social indicators: subjective and objectives; ethics of social action; general satisfaction with life; wellbeing; welfare; country project
Abstract: The paper is centered on the quality of life as a core objective of political programs, of development strategies for the country and of European projects. After the seventies, by its practical orientation, quality of life expanded rapidly from the sphere of theoretical research and analysis to the social action of changing/improving living conditions. Quality of life is not merely a simple academic topic or a nice phrase. It is increasingly present in the area of public debates, stimulating concerns/interest of political decision makers and of social stakeholders. The first part of the present paper focuses on the main factors increasing quality of life, starting from its dimensions/components. The quality of life, due to its evaluating structure, implies the value a human being gives to his/her life: how good or bad is the life one is living, as a whole, and by particular components (family, profession, work, civic, social, cultural, political life, free time, interpersonal relationships, etc.). The quality of life is estimated by a plurality of social and economic indicators, distributed by distinct life components. At the same time, a population's degree of satisfaction or dissatisfaction with life, based on specific subjective indicators, measures the impact of the outcome of social development on human condition. The second part of my paper points out the significance of quality of life as part of a strategy for maximizing the degree of individual satisfaction with his/her life. Thus, the quality of life is directly associated with a policy of change, of responsible action based on active and efficient interventions. The human significance of the direction of the development, of the targets, of the way of developing individual and collective action are integral parts of a strategy for a future country project. To this end, the orientations/options, the objectives and directions of development of a model/country project directly influence the satisfaction or dissatisfaction of the individual with his/her life. Validating the ethic norms for social action shall be supported in this context by: objective indicators for timely evaluation of the outcomes of changing the social and natural environment, subjective indicators of measuring the impact of these changes on the general satisfaction with life, comparative European statistics regarding welfare and quality of life, academic research analyses, public opinion surveys, official reports regarding social development. All of them represent measurement units/instruments and milestones for evaluating the social and human efficiency of actions based on moral regulations. In the current context of globalization, expanding the moral knowledge by assumed accountability for social actions turns into a necessity, but also into a guarantee for a sustainable development process. In this context, my paper concludes that widening the moral conscience by assumed responsibility for social action turns into an integral part of an actual process of sustainable development.

Authors: Gruia, R; Bogdan, AT; Toba, GF; Rey, R
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Gruia, Romulus; Bogdan, Alexandru T.; Toba, George Florea; Rey, Radu
Article Title: Solar Energy and Biotransformation Dynamics in the Bioeconomic Model of Food Production with the Mountain Product as a Case Study
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: bio-economy; biotransformation; eco-development; food production; mountain product
Abstract: The paper analyzes successive bioconversion of solar energy into other forms of energy specific to aliments, expressed through qualitatively superior characteristics and nutrients, in the context of economy and entropy that takes into account the environment, respectively by applying bio-economy principles. The problem of feeding the human population, with crisis potential in relation with demographic increase, may be widely solved by the bio-economic model of food production. As a factory of protein production, the perspective and operational context of animal breeding and farm field is thoroughly studied, which, similarly to bio-economic animal husbandry, will constitute in fact an intercession of equilibrium, of eco-efficiency and systemic efficacy and of perfect framing in nature demands, on the line of eco-development. There are exemplified aspects of application of the new paradigm in zones with a high degree of life and food production difficulty, respectively mountain zones. If they don't excel from a production quantity perspective, the zones with high altitude may offer bio-transformation in terms of quality and economic efficiency, from energetic point of view and related to the nutritive density of the mountain product.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Economic Development Based on Higher Education: Indian Growth and Global Norms
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Economic Development; Education; India; Poland; Romania
Abstract: Economics is known as a method of fulfilling unlimited desires with limited resources, which is directly connected with human development and our approaches in order to get basic needs and expected desires. It is education that is contributing not only to increases in an individual's income but also to the national income. Globally, it has been noticed that higher education and skilled human capital becomes the main driver of economic growth for many developed and developing economies. In the recent years, emerging economies have made fantastic progress by focusing on 'skills education' in their higher education for economic growth. India is a relevant example of education based economy, beeing the fastest growing economy in the world. With a GDP growth rate of 7.9%, a population of 1.29 billion people, occupying the second place in the world (after the USA) from the point of view of the number of English speakers, with the highest number in the world of young population aged between 16 and 35 years, with the largest number of service providers, and a growing middle-class, India has important economic growth potential for the next 30 years. This paper will address how education and educational institutions are essential for the long-run economic development of India, and how Poland and Romania can be complementary and supplementary for eachother's need for sustainable growth.
