Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Collaborative Consumption
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: consumption; collaboration; loan; network; technology; internet
Abstract: We belong today to a hyper-industrial society where we witness, sometimes with no power to intervene, rapid changes in all areas, when the adaptation rule (the species that do not adapt, disappear) becomes even more valid. Although we refer to a relatively new concept, but with ancestral roots, a prospective niche - the collaborative consumption - becomes more and more manifest. Offering a larger access to products, services, talent and experience, as compared to the possibilities given when each person is a unique owner, the collaborative consumption favors the bond between people, goods and services, which results in the creation of communities, organizations and new models of activity, both private and public. In their turn, these peer to peer models (from person to person) determine new opportunities not only for the persons included in the model, but also for communities, corporations and even governments, which should reconsider their consumption strategies as regards the positions of purchaser, seller, creditor, tenant, but without ignoring the profit.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Regional Competitiveness in Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: regional competitiveness; Romania; index of regional competitiveness
Abstract: Regional competitiveness is the way in which regions promote, attract and support economic activity to achieve a high standard of living for its inhabitants. Thus, regions have no other option than to strive to be competitive, to survive in the new global market in order to face new competition. This study aims to substantiate a methodology for evaluating rural competitiveness in regional profiles. Thus, the analysis is an assessment of competitiveness of Romania's eight rural development regions versus national competitiveness. This evaluation was conducted using an index of competitiveness, which included a series of indicators to measure competitiveness considered representative.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Foreign Direct Investments and their Impact on Wages in the Romanian Economy
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: standard of living; employment; foreign companies; statistical methods
Abstract: One of the research topics on the effects of foreign direct investments (FDI) refers to the impact of foreign direct investments on wages. As a result, this paper aims to analyse the link between the FDI stocks and the gross average earning in Romania. The data are recorded per annum over the 2004-2014 period. The statistical methods applied in order to assess the impact of the FDI stocks on the gross average earning are correlation analysis and regression analysis. The results show that FDI stocks affect average wages in the Romanian economy. Therefore, if foreign direct investment stocks increase by one million euros, the variable of the gross average earning will increase, on average, by 0.006 Euros.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Baleanu, Daniela Nicoleta; Bozga, Raluca Elisabeta
Article Title: Trends in the Medicinal and Aromatic Plant Market in Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: medicinal plants; essential oils; plants market
Abstract: The paper analyzes the availability of medicinal and aromatic plants in Romania, their economic value and capitalization opportunities. We consider the wild and cultivated medicinal and aromatic plants market, including the segments of this market that trades the products of the plants' processing. We also present data regarding the evolution in this domain, particularly the changes that took place after 1989 in Romania. The data are described and compared with those in European countries with tradition in this domain.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Establishing a New System for Petroleum Royalties in Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: oil and gas industry; royalties; sustainability
Abstract: Nowadays, there are three major global systems of tax on hydrocarbon exploitation. Given these factors, the most important question is, in fact, what is the best tax system for the oil and gas industry? As a fundamental principle, such a system must be so as to maximize the return to the state and to attract and retain capital and technology investment. This article proposes a new system of taxation of hydrocarbons that could adopt a differentiated royalty model, with two pillars-for existing operations or for new ones. Moreover, we believe that the new system of taxation of hydrocarbons should provide different levels of royalties for operating onshore and offshore. Also, there should be differentiation between shallow and deep offshore deposits, because of differences in costs involved. The effects of the application of a new system are: increasing contribution to consolidated state budget; efficient management of the productive potential of existing deposits and sustainable use of internal oil and gas resources; and increasing foreign direct investment inflows in oil and gas extraction, particularly in the Black Sea continental shelf.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Food Security: A Challenge for China and Russia to Resolve in Northeast Asia
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Food Security; Northeast Asia; Regional Integration; Food Sovereignty; Far East
Keywords Plus: POLICIES; TRADE; INDIA
Abstract: Food security concerns in the region of Northeast Asia are among the most critical. For the countries in the region, providing the growing population with food in sufficient quantity and variety is a challenge, which includes a range of issues of food production, import dependence and export orientation of the food market, solvency and dietary patterns. Despite the rapid growth of agricultural production complexes and long traditions of the rural way of life, domestic food production in the region of Northeast Asia fails to meet demand. Even big and completive agricultural producers such as China and Russia have, to some extent, to rely on agricultural imports, suffering from price fluctuations on the global market, which threaten their food security. This paper includes an overview of the current state of agricultural production and food consumption trade in the region of Northeast Asia, primarily China's Northeast and Russia's Far East, with particular attention to the development of rural territories. Influences of the interregional collaboration between China and Russia on food security in the macro region of Northeast Asia are discussed. This paper is concluded with an overview of expected influences of the development of rural territories on domestic food markets, sustainability of agricultural production, and food security.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: EU-China Food Trade Perspectives
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: China; EU food trade; food security
Keywords Plus: SECURITY
Abstract: At present, one of the main concerns of decidents form China is to ensure food security for its large population. About one fifth of the global population is living in China, on 1/15 of rural land and using only 8% of the fresh water resources. At the same time, the degree of urbanization and the disposable incomes are increasing with a high speed. This all means that the food consuming pattern in China is also changing, and food consumption in the country will grow in both quantity and quality. EU-China trade relations are complicated and protectionism can be seen on both sides. The EU have large trade deficits with China. Most member states also have large deficits, but not Germany and Finland. EU member states have very different positions about trade relations with China. In the food sector the EU experiences overproduction, closed markets in the Russian Federation, and internal market tensions. Furthermore, the EU has placed a strong emphasis on speeding up free trade agreements with Asian countries, including China, but there are no plausible results yet.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Side Effects of Subsidizing Renewable Energy Production in Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: renewable energy; subsidy; green certificate; side effects
Abstract: This article analyzes the secondary/unintentional effects of subsidizing renewable energy production in Romania and other European countries, following the application of the European Union (EU) Climate and Energy 2020 legislative package. Economic instruments create incentives to promote environmental protection measures. In seeking to boost renewable energies, EU member states have chosen the method of subsidies granted to investors or a bonus for each MWh of electricity produced and uploaded to the network. Direct effects of renewable energy should be the elimination of polluting energy sources. This does not take place, at least in Romania, due to the nature of the installations producing renewable energy: they cannot provide energy twenty-four hours day, which requires the existence of backup equipment that comes into operation when it is not windy or at night. Therefore, technologies for producing renewable electricity cannot be considered mature after ten years of granting massive subsidy.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: The Romanian ICT Sector in the European Context
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: ICTs; digital skills; e-business; business digitisation; information society; knowledge based economy
Keywords Plus: PRODUCTIVITY GROWTH; IMPACT
Abstract: The ICTs stand at the centre of the flagship initiative The Digital Agenda for Europe, while the Digital Single Market Strategy is among the top ten political priorities for the EU. There are, also, other EU initiatives designed to address the challenge of ICT skills shortages on the European labour market, mobilizing all important stakeholders in the education and business sectors to cooperate to ensure the stock of digital talent and the digital skills necessary for the knowledge economy and information society. Romania has assumed targets regarding ICT, in line with the EU agenda, through the National Strategy on Digital Agenda for Romania. Our paper aims to look into the national capacity to develop its ICT potential in order to reach its targets, to become relevant in the highly virtualized global economy, and to provide viable and effective solutions to the current and future societal demands. To this end, based on international reports and Eurostat data analysis, we will assess the national ICT readiness and potential, its relevance and importance, as well as the ICT skills in the workforce and the population. We would also draw main areas of intervention for improving the Romanian landscape, which seems rather bleak against the EU background.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Does Forecasting the Oil with Nonlinear Models Produce Nonlinear Forecasts?
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: nonlinear models; nonlinearity tests; forecasts
Keywords Plus: TESTS; CHAOS
Abstract: The literature on forecasting energy prices with nonlinear models has produced general agreement that these nonlinear models can provide accurate forecasts. However, these forecasts have been analysed solely from the perspective of forecast accuracy. The literature has not addressed the question of whether these models generate energy prices forecasts that are themselves nonlinear. This paper provides a preliminary answer to this question, by performing a comparative test on the nonlinear properties of forecasts for oil prices generated by nonlinear models. The results provide clear evidence in favour of the hypothesis that nonlinear models can generate nonlinear forecasts for oil prices.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Romanian Agriculture Support Scenarios for the Next 20 Years
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Common Agricultural Policy; direct payments; rural development; national budget; Romania
Abstract: Romania's accession to the European Union has brought predictability to the support to agriculture, due to the multi-annual financial programming of European funds, and the total public funds destined to agriculture have continuously increased and will continue to increase until the year 2020. The three projected scenarios for the evolution of agriculture in the next 20 years (optimistic, realistic and pessimistic) took into consideration a wide range of economic, social and demographic evolutions, and mainly the future of the Common Agricultural Policy, which featured stability and increased financial support in the optimistic scenario, similar financing to the current period in the realistic scenario and a drastic diminution of financing in the pessimistic scenario.

Authors: Toma, C; Gavrilescu, C; Turtoi, C
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Toma, Camelia; Gavrilescu, Camelia; Turtoi, Crina
Article Title: Increase of Value Added for Agricultural Products - An Analysis of the Implementation of Measure 123 in the NPRD 2007-2013
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: European Funds; financing rate; agri-food; regional distribution
Abstract: The analysis is following the degree of attaining the goal of Measure 123, from a financial and physical point of view, but also of the efficiency, regional distribution, the type and profile of the beneficiaries of European funds for investments in the field of agri-food processing. The statistical data processing from the European reports for financing monitoring have put into evidence, at the end of the year 2015, a financing rate of 88% from the measure's allocation at European level. In Romania, there were signed contracts for which payments were made, the share of which exceeded 90%. Because of the prolonged period of making investments, 9% of the projects were transferred to financing from the new NPRD. From total measure, 86% of the projects with 89% of the value are in the agri-food industry sector, the rest (14%) of the number and value are coming from the sector of wood processing, the renewable energy production and bio-fuels for self consumption and other sectors. From the sector of food industry, the highest share is represented by investments in storage, processing of cereals, and bakery with 555 projects (59%) with a value of over (sic)300 million. In the regions South and South-East, the most projects (39%) are concentrated with 45% of the measure's value.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Impact of Coupled Subsidies on the Romanian Soybean Market
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Soybeans; coupled subsidies; import and export price
Abstract: In the paper, we quantified the impact of the government's Decision no. 219/2015 upon the soybean market in Romania in the year 2015. For this purpose, we collected data on the soybean areas, production and trade with soybeans and soybean meal, as well as the prices for these products, both domestic prices and foreign trade prices. Based on existing data, we also estimated the minimum coupled support received by farmers per ton of soybeans and per cultivated hectare. The farmers who cultivated soybeans in the year 2015 could receive the amount of (sic)373.3/ha, out of which total subsidy for soybeans (sic)181/ton, of which (sic)113/ton represented the national coupled support. If we compare the annual (2015) average soybean price without subsidy ((sic)480/ ton) and the import price ((sic)434/ton), we could draw the conclusion that Romania does not have a competitive advantage in soybean cultivation. At the same time, we find out that by subsidizing the domestic soybean production, the exported soybean production increased to 95,000 tons, and with this export, we also exported the subsidy worth (sic)10.735 million.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Revenge of the Globalization Losers
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: globalisation; unemployment; financial crisis; technological progress; middle class; labour market; structural reforms; classic reform policies; isolation and populism; International Trade; European Union
Abstract: The management of the globalisation challenges and opportunities by the European Union shows some weaknesses and the strength of the tools used does not match the social capacity to assimilate them. The quality of the EU governance is a reason why globalisation and belonging to the Euro Zone has caused damage not only to some social groups, but to whole nations (Greece, Spain, Portugal, and Italy). The cause is not the financial crisis, but the neglect of the structural reforms. There have been long debates on the effects of failure, but no solutions have been suggested (systems of education, health care, pensions, labour productivity stimulation, etc.). Our paper, presented on other occasions1 as well, aims to explain the state of today's globalisation, considering international trade.

Article Title: Assessment of State-Owned Enterprises from Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: State-owned enterprises; Romania's economic branches; management activities; market perspectives
Keywords Plus: CONSUMERS BEHAVIOR; TOURISM; MARKET
Abstract: The research analyzes the activity of the state-owned companies from Romania and their place in the economic development of a country. Further attention will be paid to the analysis of the market as the place where the private enterprises and state-owned enterprises meet in particular branches of the economy. This research study is completed with an analysis of the current situation of state-owned companies from Romania in the contemporary economy, with conclusions that further underline their evolution. The results will reveal the importance of the management activity for these companies based on certified results and will represent a starting point for further research within this field.

Authors: Muscalu, MS; Bulearca, M; Neagu, C; Sima, C
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Muscalu, Mihai-Sabin; Bulearca, Marius; Neagu, Cornelia; Sima, Cristian
Article Title: Strategic Options to Capitalize the Mineral and Energy Resources of Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: oil; natural gas; coal; non-ferrous ores; uranium ores; energy strategy
Abstract: As globalization is increasingly manifest, an urgent mission of great responsibility is more clearly emerging, that is the right mediation between the trend of integration into the global structures, on one hand, and national identity on the other, much in line with current and future objectives of the Romanian economy in general, and the extractive industry in particular. In this context, risks and threats to accessing energy and non-energy strategic resources are increasingly diversified. Therefore, the strategic options were based on the strengths and opportunities identified in the SWOT analysis (presented in our previous works), and intended to offset weaknesses and avoid threats, according to prioritization, the efficient use of mineral and energy resources (crude oil, natural gas, coal, metal ores and uranium) and positive experiences. Based on these assumptions, in this article we have identified several possible strategic options for achieving the objectives for the exploitation of mineral and energy resources in Romania until 2035. The magnitude of benefits resulting from the implementation of these options will depend on the quality of the decisions that society will take as a political and administrative system, and guarantor of security and welfare of the population.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Gaf-Deac, Ioan I.; Ciutacu, Otilia Teodora
Article Title: Co-location and Economic Growth in Clustered Areas
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: co-location subsystems; economic growth; decay productive economy; cluster
Keywords Plus: DYNAMICS
Abstract: Co-location of natural resources subsystems with productive subsystems, social and infrastructural areas lead to a new economic report, measured by indicators of economic prosperity. Research literature has revealed significant links between co-location and prosperity rate. To quantify a clustering profile, the use of resources is an useful conceptual and practical immersion in at least three projects, namely: a) flow elements for developing new sector, which highlights how to build a cluster, to acquire as principal dynamic characteristic, b) elements of knowledge flow and assimilation of opportunities within a cluster; c) analysis of stream elements at different scales and at different levels of comparison of the corresponding operational cluster. Being considered higher level in relation to industrial leadership in a complex, a logical cluster is ranked with comparative higher chance of success in almost all cases of its existence and functioning. On the fundamental expression, cluster phenomenon may be included in the evolutionary stages of the new economy toward a knowledge economy Authors of the research literature expresses the observation that confidence in the applied clustering phenomenon in a national economy is growing, although structural operationalization of clusters starts to break down those productive economy in distinct geographic industrial areas.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Economic Activity, Producing Entropy, Depleted Resources in the Biosphere of Deltas as a Closed System - Sustainable Management
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: entropy; sustainable management; natural capital; tool for preservation biological diversity
Abstract: An increase based solely on economic pragmatism has its limits beyond which we not only could ensure sustainable development and well-being of future generations of mankind, but the human species itself would be doomed to disappear. Economic activities based on nonsomatic instruments, focused on educational activities, cultural, social, research according to bioeconomical approaches could mean sustainable development for aquatic and terrestrial ecosystems and protected areas. Understanding the biosphere as a closed system and economic activity of man producing entropy that will deplete resources and considering the truth demonstrated by the mathematician and economist Nicholas Georgescu-Roegen in The Entropy Law and the Economic Process (1971) proposes to get out of this continuous battle that mankind goes against the environment and against herself by applying an ethic that would take into account the needs and security of future generations.

Authors: Badileanu, M; Ciumac, S; Georgescu, LI
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Badileanu, Marina; Ciumac, Svetlana; Georgescu, Luminita Izabell
Article Title: Regional Shifts of Multinational Public Utility Companies
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: multi-national companies; regional distribution; electricity; water supply
Abstract: The regional development of public utilities services' supply depends on a number of factors, such as: endowment with natural resources of the region, the level of economic development, the urban/rural ratio, degree of compliance with local communities to EU directives (for instance, drinking water supply and access to sewerage networks) etc. At the same time, the interest of specialized multinational companies for one region or another is determined by criteria that include, besides the above-mentioned, other factors such as existing infrastructure, the demand for public utilities, the availability of tax or financial incentives (green certificates in renewable energy) etc. The paper aims to map out the evolution of regional interest of these companies, their financial and accounting situation, their concern for social responsibility of corporate governance depending on the area they serve, etc.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Convergence and Divergence Patterns in the EU and Romanian Regions
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: real convergence; convergence indicators; EU and Romanian regions; regional policy
Keywords Plus: EUROPEAN-UNION; INCOME INEQUALITY; REAL CONVERGENCE; PER-CAPITA; GROWTH; PRODUCTIVITY; DISPARITIES; STATES
Abstract: In the current context of increased pressure on the process of European Union integration, one of the primary goals is the convergence of the regional income per capita and, hence, how to generate a process of convergence not only conducive to benefits to all EU citizens, but also perceived and valued as such. In the economic literature, theories of convergence and divergence examine the reasons for diminishing or increasing the disparities between rich and the poor regions, and in the case of divergence, explain the persistence of such disparities. Based on the concept of real convergence, the paper presents an analysis of such a process in the EU and Romanian regions, based on specific indicators (GDP per capita, gross speed of convergence). The results show different convergence speeds and patterns both in the EU and in Romania, the economies of the regions adapting differently to the challenging economic environment of the EU single market, generally dependent on their pre-accession development level. The results are in line with the findings of other studies on the economic convergence of the member states and/or their regions, but also reveal some peculiarities of the catching up and development processes going on in the EU and Romanian regional economies, especially calling for increased attention to be paid to the implementation of the national general and development policies at all levels, as well as of the EU regional policy.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: State Aid Policy in the Post-Crisis Period: Implications for the Stability of the European Financial Sector
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: State Aid Policy; financial sector; BRRD Directive
Abstract: The State Aid Policy has undergone a major reform process during the post-crisis period, a series of new rules (BRRD Directive, The Temporary Framework for State Aid for the Banking System) being enforced at the European level in order to support and ensure the stability of the EU's financial sector. Our paper aims to assess the effectiveness of the reformed state aid policy in preserving the stability of European banks in particular and of the financial system in general. For this objective, our research will use both a quantitative assessment, based on the latest State Aid Scoreboard Data, but also a qualitative analysis based the most relevant theoretical approaches. The final part of our article presents the authors' conclusions regarding State Aid Policy as a tool of preserving the stability of the European Financial sector in the post-crisis period.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Bank De-Risking Impacts on Finance and Development. The Case of Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: de-risking; banking system; corresponding banks; AML/CFT; financial stability; non-performing loans; financial inclusion
Abstract: The study aims to investigate the causes, external manifestations and impacts of the phenomenon of de-risking, increasingly rendered visible in the last years on international financial markets, under the circumstances of the post-crisis global economic developments. The paper reveals that this phenomenon is still little discussed and understood by academics and institutional organizations, consequently being ignored by any theoretical foundation or arguments for the possible guidance, between one direction or the other, of policies, norms and regulatory practices in order to monitor and address the slippages with adverse effects. In the paper, the stage of actual knowledge of this phenomenon, as concerns the different forms of manifestation, the main causes and factors of influence, the adverse impact observed and possible counteracting measures are presented. The paper presents some reference points for decoding this phenomenon, proposing new directions for more in-depth scientific researches, focusing on the identification of specific solutions based on customized analysis, including for Romania's case, considering the trade-off options, such as stability versus prudentiality in risk taking and risk management, profitability versus social responsibility under uncertainty conditions, banking system interests versus interests of regulatory and supervisory institutions, and monetary policies versus government policy and strategies.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Crisis and Monetary Policy - the Romanian Experience
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Macroeconomic forecast; economic crisis; monetary policy; central banks; financial markets
Abstract: The international financial crisis that started in 2007 changed the monetary policy. Old instruments became ineffective and new instruments were applied. The Romanian economy followed the experience of other countries and also applied new instruments in order to reach the monetary objective to keep inflation under control and sustain the economic development. This paper tries to highlight the impact of monetary policy during the crises on development and ISD flow in Romania using the VAR and VEC models on the quarterly data. The results show that before the crisis there was no long-term relation between money demand and GDP as a theory, but, after the crisis, there was a negative long-term relation, probably as a result of the financial instability and the great injection of money in order to cover the bad loans and to prevent a banking system crisis. Hagmayr and Haiss (2007) and Haiss and Kichler (2009) also highlight a negative relation between the domestic bad credit and GDP.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Addressing an Environmental Risks Matrix
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: pollution; environmental risks; impact of risks; financing needs; quantified risk
Abstract: The paper presents the main steps to the identification and definition of the sources and targets of the financial flows required for the diminution and complete removal, if possible, of pollution as well as the reconstruction of the financial mechanisms and instruments of environmental protection aiming at the environment consumers; the elaboration of the managerial construct as a subsystem and of the integrative financial architecture oriented toward the institutionalization, instrumentation and holding responsible the participants in control, and toward diminution and removal of environmental risks. Risks related to the use of products sometimes cause the discontinuation of the products by manufacturers, while risks concerning so-called free goods, i.e. air and water pollution, have become a reason for criminal responsibility. As economic theory is about to abandon the concept of free goods, i.e., to introduce the concept of inferred values to be accounted for, free risk should be accepted as risks caused by humans, which must respond to the generator thereof, particularly those who produce dangerous goods.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Migration between Blocking and Lasting Forever - A Component of the Way from Government to Governance and Back
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: globalisation; geopolitics; geoeconomics; emigration; immigration; economic and social governance
Abstract: Migration is not a recent phenomenon. Since ancient times it has been a dramatic challenge: pushed by hunger, famine, and scarcity people have migrated to other lands for a better life. Today they do the same. It is a migration for economic reasons. It has produced emigrants. But what about the migration caused by religious, national and racial persecution, by domestic, regional or world wars, by huge natural cataclysms or by racial hatred? This kind of migration has produced no-country people, outlaws, better called refugees.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: The Contribution of Total Factor Productivity, Capital and Labor Force to the Output Growth of the Romanian Manufacturing Subsectors
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: growth accounting; permanent inventory method; manufacturing subsectors; total factor productivity; capital; labor force
Abstract: Analyzing the drivers of output growth at the sectoral level facilitates the understanding of the Romanian industry growth profile and the economic factors that affect sectoral and structural evolutions. With this in mind, the paper identifies the contribution of total factor productivity, capital and labor force on the output growth for ten manufacturing subsectors of the Romanian economy. The contributions of the paper are twofold. From a methodological and statistical perspective, the paper calculates the capital stock for ten manufacturing subsectors using the permanent inventory method and builds a Cobb-Douglas production function for each of the ten subsectors as well as estimates of total factor productivity. From an applied perspective, the paper builds profiles and clusters of the Romanian manufacturing subsectors with similar behaviors in terms of the impact of production factors on output. This facilitates an understanding of the impact of economic policies affecting capital and labor force on the subsectors evolution.

Authors: Cucui, I; Coman, DM; Ionescu, CA; Coman, MD
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Cucui, Ion; Coman, Dan Marius; Ionescu, Constantin Aurelian; Coman, Mihaela Denisa
Article Title: Mountain Economy Under the Impact of Information and Communication Technologies
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Mountain economy; information technologies; communication technologies; web applications; e-commerce
Abstract: Starting from the assumption that, at the global level, mountains cover 25% of the Earth's surface and are inhabited by more than 12% of the world population, and that mountain ecosystems are genuine reservoirs of biodiversity providing water, agri-food products, minerals, timber, building materials, and numerous energy sources, we should point out and emphasize the need to adjust mountain economy to the exhaustive expansion of information and communication technology. Information technologies represent an opportunity for economic entities in mountainous areas due to the services that give the possibility of creating web applications for electronic commerce, for product tracking and traceability, etc. Web applications are developed based on facile services provided by various companies, such as Microsoft, Oracle, which aim to bring technology closer to the business environment and especially to support those outsourced businesses. This paper aims to present mountain economy, given the development of information and communication technologies.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: To What Extent are Country Rankings from Composite Indicators Relevant? Proposing an Alternative Method of Reporting Composite Indicators Results
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Human Development Index; indicator methodology; composite indicator
Abstract: Much media and public policy attention is devoted to country rankings generated by composite indicators. However, annual rankings have limited relevance, not only because the relative position of some particular countries changes from year to year without any major impact for the countries in question, but also due to the fact that they do not account for the actual gaps in indicator performance. This paper addresses these flaws by proposing a change in current reporting methodologies for composite indicators, which makes results perfectly comparable with respect to relative performance gaps between countries, ensures complete comparability between annual performances, and makes time comparisons against relative peer performances feasible without further calculations. Results reported using the new methodology point out the relative size of the differences between countries with respect to HDI scores, and can be used to assess the actual gaps between countries, and determine whether score changes are truly significant over chosen periods of time. This approach makes a reality check of media claims, and, if used, will help in making a more objective interpretation of countries' performance as a guide for public policies.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Predictions Regarding the Economic Implications, Market Development, Opportunities and Constraints of Capitalizing on Romanian Mountain Products in a Sustainable Vision
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: mountain product; organic fertilizers; cooperatives; markets; constraints
Abstract: The idea of capitalizing on certain niche food products with a high bio-energetic quality, obtained in the unpolluted mountain environment, stems from the developments that occurred due to population growth and pollution factors in the intensive production systems of large-scale agriculture and the agri-food industry practices regarding preservation, taste, and color, which can harm health. New regulation no. 1151/2012 and EC Delegated Regulation no. 665/2014 regarding mountain products. Government Decision. no. 506/2016, which establishes the institutional framework and implements some measures for it, emerged in Romania. Romania, with about 2.9 million hectares of mountain and farmland, is interested in capitalizing on mountain products, which are based on multifloral grass, ruminants, organic fertilizers and the difficult labor of small mountain farmers. Mountain products will be able to be sold nationally directly by farmers, if they form their market. On a large scale, the capitalization internally and externally on mountain products requires the association with grade I and II cooperative systems. The main objective is increasing farmers' incomes and fighting poverty. The constraints are found in the low prices for meat, milk etc., the lack of organization in associative-cooperative forms and the predictable competitive reactions of the industrial actors.

Authors: Zubovic, J; Jelocnik, M; Subic, J
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Zubovic, Jovan; Jelocnik, Marko; Subic, Jonel
Article Title: Farmland Affordability in Serbia
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Farmland affordability; Republic of Serbia; Farmland price
Abstract: By signing the SAA agreement Serbia is committed by 01/09/2017 to change regulations related to sale of agricultural land, which is to grant EU citizens the same rights as the local population have in buying land in Serbia. The aim of this paper is to assess availability of farmland by applying the affordability index, as well as to compare the farmland affordability for EU citizens in their respective countries and in Serbia. Comparative analysis has been conducted with all EU countries, with a special emphasis on Romania, Poland and Slovenia, countries that have a similar environment to Serbia in the field of agriculture. The results show that when comparing the price of agricultural land in Serbia in 2014 and 2015, it is less affordable for Poles and Romanians. On the other hand, it is more affordable for Slovenians, and significantly affordable for Germans, French, Italians, Belgians, Danes and the Dutch. In other words, for farmers from those countries buying agricultural land in Serbia land is five to eleven times more affordable compared with the purchasing power of the local population. Further research in this field is required, especially given the fact that there is a methodological mismatch in recording and calculating average prices of farmland in the EU.

Authors: Salasan, C; Otiman, PI; Gosa, V; Mateoc-Sîrb, N
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Salasan, Cosmin; Otiman, Paun Ion; Gosa, Vasile; Mateoc-Sirb, Nicoleta
Article Title: The Link Between the Native Potential for Rural Development of a Territory and the Expectations of its Relevant Actors
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: rural development; endogenous potential; territorial favorability; Community-Led Local Development
Abstract: The place and the role of native or endogenous potential in terms of rural development is frequently placed in a central position when different analysis tools are employed and used to justify the orientation of a series of interventions, particularly when public funding is consistently used. The rationale behind this natural link points to the problem-solving by local readiness and normal expectations aiming to highlight not only the needs, but the most fitted interventions for the territory. In our approach, these elements are analyzed in a comparative manner between two significantly different territories, in terms of favorability and suitability of different interventions and development support instruments. The expectations and the interventions (as project intentions) related to rural development in a Community Led Local Development approach following the specific actions of animation and information led to a uniform knowledge and understanding, in which the actors had the freedom to express their immediate future project-based actions. The analysis considers the general orientation of preferences, the readiness (including own financial contribution) and the link with the territory's potential. Furthermore, it compares the two territories in both agriculture and rural development potential and expectations. The conclusions lead beyond the usual lack of understanding or incomplete information passed to local actors and expose the genuine orientation at community level, but individually promoted.

Authors: Avadanei, V; Surdu, I; Avadanei, L
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Avadanei, Vasile; Surdu, Ioan; Avadanei, Lidia
Article Title: Mountain Peasant Household Between Employment and Entrepreneurship
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: mountain development; entrepreneurship; mountaineering; mountain homestead
Keywords Plus: FAMILY
Abstract: There is a great interest in maintaining and strengthening the traditional peasant farm as a reference unit in mountain development and to support the commercial consecration of mountain products. For the model to become operational it is necessary to make an assessment of the key elements that make it functional. It is necessary to build a model adapted to the economic and social variables. The aim of this study is to analyze the elements of the traditional mountain peasant farm and to integrate the requirements of competitiveness. There are taken into account cultural elements for conserving the specificity and traditionalism from montain rural areas. It also examines how the human resources system trails can integrate occupational reference, so that it can meet the challenges of economic and social integration in the food market. A testing of model result is equally an economic and cultural challenge.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Issues and Trends of Eco-innovation. Promoting the Green Economy in Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: sustainable development; green economy; circular economy; industrial symbiosis; eco-innovation parks
Abstract: In this paper we present, in a synthetic way, the most important research outcomes of the project on The role of innovation in promoting a green economy in Romania. First, we outline the main features and principles of the green economy and especially the necessity for increasing resource efficiency, for implementing and monitoring all the latest strategies of sustainable economic growth in the European Union and consequently, in Romania. A conceptual and empirical analysis of eco-innovation follows, introducing the concept of eco-innovation parks. There is a pointing to the positive direct correlation between eco-innovation parks (EInvP) and resource productivity revealed by recent national and international surveys as well as by our own research. In the second part of the paper, we analyze some of the latest national and European trends and issues of eco-innovation. The conclusions and recommendations of the paper outline some progress, but also some difficulties in eco-innovation promoting the green economy in Romania, as well as the expected prospects and policies.

Authors: Goschin, Z; Druica, E; Grigore, AM
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Goschin, Zizi; Druica, Elena; Grigore, Ana-Maria
Article Title: Spatial Analysis of Regional Variation in Self-Employment Density in Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: self-employed person; spatial model; county; Romania
Keywords Plus: ENTREPRENEURSHIP
Abstract: The steady increase in the number of self-employed persons in Romania in the last two decades illustrates the growing entrepreneurial spirit, especially among young people, but might also be the consequence of worsening labor market circumstances in the context of recent global crisis and slow economic recovery, as self-employment might be an alternative solution when jobs are scarce. Responding to the information needs of the decision-making process in this area and given the high variation in the regional density of self-employment in Romania, our paper seeks to explore its underlying factors of influence, both during and following the recent economic crisis. To this end, we applied appropriate methods of spatial analysis that take into account the spatial autocorrelation patterns exhibited by our data. We tested various model specifications and found the spatial models to be a better fit for the data, compared to classic regression. In line with the mainstream literature, our annual estimations, covering the interval 2008 to 2014, pointed to gross domestic product (GDP) per capita as the main factor of influence on the distribution of self-employment density across Romanian counties. Another positive determinant is the share of young persons in the total population of the county, while foreign direct investments (FDIs) exert a negative effect.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: The Romanian Agriculture Challenges - Organic Products
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: agriculture; organic products; challenges; Romania
Abstract: Organic farming is one positive and complex way to give a proper response to the many environmental problems posed by the agricultural sector in its continuous efforts of increasing output, efficiency and competitiveness on both EU and international markets. The interest of the EU for organic farming and products has grown in the last decades and the members have promoted farming and consumption of organic products as a response to increasing chemical use in farming and consequently to the pollution of soil and water, as well as of agricultural and food products. Romania showed interest in organic farming since the pre-accession period, when it started implementing the acquis communautaire in this field, and organic farming appeared in the general picture of agriculture. The paper presents the analysis of the recent evolutions in the Romanian organic farming, as well as the development and implementation of the EU and national regulations in the field. Also, it highlights the past, present and future challenges, the ways of removing obstacles and dealing with threats. The results show that the consumers' response has been increasingly positive, although the higher prices for organic food remained a barrier to a wider expansion of demand.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Harmonisation of the Financing Structure with the Objective of Sustainable Development at the Micro Level. Specific Aspects of Companies in the Real Economy of Romania during 2007-2014
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: working capital; requirement of working capital; financial state
Abstract: The decision to structure the capital presumes choosing a mix of debts and own capitals to ensure a sustainable economic development, in agreement with the evolution of the limitations imposed by the economic, social and natural environment. The theories of capital structure provide the basic directions in this respect. However, a particular theory will not be enough to deal with all these problems. On the one hand, the macroeconomic scenario plays a significant role; on the other hand, internal factors, specific to the company, are at the forefront. Thus, one of the most important problems of companies in Romania refers to the evaluation and selection of models and policies of capital structure in accordance with their current and prospective activity. This paper provides a descriptive analysis by components of the financing structure, using data from the accounting balance sheets of companies from the real economy of Romania, in 2007-2014. Conclusions include possible scenarios of evolution of Romanian companies in relation with the factors of influence at the macro- and microeconomic levels.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: One Decade from Romania's Accession to the European Union. A National Strategic Project Is Required
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Romania; European Union; national interests; sustainable economic growth; globalisation challenges; modernisation of Romania; national strategic project; global network of multiple national interests; real convergence; structural reforms; civic education; professional education; governance; economic policies
Abstract: For a national project or for the national interest to be promoted, we should consider the realities of our world and an appropriate assessment of our power within the external forces. Romania has gained much by adapting to the world, and now it is a member of the Euro-Atlantic family, with a good macroeconomic status following a political adoption of good economic discipline/practice that should go on. Romania seems to enjoy the strongest strategic partnership with NATO and the USA (considering the realities of the Ukrainian crisis) and an increasing geopolitical visibility. At the same time, Romania may become more credible and able to involve the citizens in a medium or long-term national strategic project in order to take advantage of the above opportunities.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Influence of Foreign Direct Investment on the Romanian Economy
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: FDI; correlation; linear regression; resultant variables
Keywords Plus: INTERNATIONAL-TRADE
Abstract: The article deals with the influence of the stock of foreign direct investment (FDI) on the component activities of the Romanian economy, expressed in terms of changes in the turnover of companies, labor utilization, overall productivity, value added and exports. The main conclusion of the analysis is that the beneficial changes that occurred were, however, still far from the ones expected, which means that the model of structuring and development of the Romanian economy specific to the centralized economy period remains broadly the same.

Authors: Sandulescu, A; Carlea, F; Rudi, M
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Sandulescu, Alexandru; Carlea, Filip; Rudi, Marta
Article Title: Increasing the Republic of Moldova's Security of Energy Supply through Integration with the Romanian Energy Market
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: security of energy supply; Republic of Moldova; interconnections; energy policy; energy strategy; energy market
Abstract: The Republic of Moldova (RM) is highly dependent on imports of natural gas, electricity and oil products. The regional context is changing both politically and economically, and consequently energy flows in the region will change in the next decades. This will further increase the energy supply risks of the Republic of Moldova. RM signed an Association Agreement with the European Union in 2014, committing itself to fully transpose EU legislation in key areas, including energy. This will allow it to gradually integrate RM's energy sector into the EU-wide internal energy market, but keeping as competitors RM's traditional eastern suppliers of gas and electricity. To achieve this goal, new gas and electricity interconnections should be built and flows on some of the existing gas interconnections with Romania and Ukraine should be reversed. Despite their role in increasing the level of security of energy supply, commercial viability of some new interconnections is low and regulated mechanisms should be implemented in order to secure the investment recovery. The authors researched and proposed such a mechanism for the new gas interconnection with Romania, fully compatible with EU legislation, and based on a unified gas transmission tariff.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Beef Availability in Romania - A Long-Term Analysis from a Self-Sufficiency Perspective
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Self-sufficiency in beef; investments; production
Abstract: From the perspective of reaching food security, for Romania, beef meat (accounting for 10% of the total meat consumption structure, in the year 2015) is important both for dietary diversity and for the complex contribution to the valorization of the country's agricultural resources, through the export of live animals inclusively. With a decrease by 45% of (live weight) beef production, in the period of 2007-2014, the Romanian beef sector cannot capitalize on the opportunities provided by the European Single Market. Having in view that self-sufficiency in beef was down from 96% in 2007 to 82% in 2014, and to 79% in 2015, the purpose of the paper is to identify new opportunities for relaunching meat production, through investments, in the long term. The analisys is based on the assessment of financial necessities on the three horizons, short-term (2025), medium- (2038) and long-term (2038), both for measures implemented from the National Rural Development Planfor 2007-2013 period and for the measures financed from the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development budget.

Authors: Castañeda, R; De los Ríos, I; Domínguez, L
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Castaneda, Rodrigo; De los Rios, Ignacio; Dominguez, Larissa
Article Title: Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land: Towards Voluntary Guidelines in the Context of Food Security
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Land governance; food security; poverty eradication; rural development; social conflicts
Abstract: Previous approaches of land governance led to large-scale investments that responded to economic models based on intensive extraction and exploitation of natural resources. As available resources decrease, tension is building up increasingly. For this reason, the international community is very interested in finding a new approach for land governance. The governance of land has become crucial for political and scientific research on rural development and environmental conservation. Especially within the framework of food security, it became increasingly important as land became the target of large-scale investments. This research revises the previous approaches that the international community has used for land governance and how their consequences led to the wide negotiation process that concluded with the creation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security is analyzed. The results show two fundamental facts suggesting that these guidelines represent a valuable tool to solve natural resources conflicts and strengthen peace processes, especially in the post-conflict countries. Firstly, they emphasize a multi-sectoral approach and permanent dialogue between the various actors involved, which favors reconciliation and enhancement of solidarity linkages among them. Secondly, it emphasizes a new model of action for FAO, which embraces this strong openness to include different stakeholders in its processes.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: Identifying Commercial Risks by Means of an Anti-dumping Regulation, using as an Example the Republic of Belarus
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: anti-dumping regulation; risk; non-market economy; normal price; transition economies
Abstract: In this article, the risks of exporters due to specific protection measures of modern trade policy are analyzed, using as an example the Republic of Belarus. The set of risks is divided into two groups: non-specific risks that are typical of the majority of states, and specific risks that are typical for non-market economies: The price conjuncture of the Belarusian products export is analyzed. The results confirmed the high vulnerability of its major constituents to anti-dumping proceedings. Mechanisms minimizing the threat of anti-dumping proceedings in respect of Belarusian producers-exporters are suggested. Approaches to improving economic practices and normative legal provisions are suggested.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Article Title: What is Important in Life for Men and Women from Romania - A Comparative Study
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: SAH data; stochastic order; progress index; life priorities; World Values Survey
Abstract: In this paper we analyze the opinions of the Romanian people regarding the importance in life of several variables such as: family, friends, leisure time, politics, work or religion. The responses of Romanians in 2012 about the common worth in their life are self-assessed data (SAH data). We established a hierarchy of the mentioned variables by the stochastic order relation applied to categorial ordinal variables. Since the stochastic order is not a total order relation, we suggested in addition a progress indicator (PSA) which is compatible with this relation. A minimal set of axioms are compulsorily imposed to design a concrete PSA coefficient for measuring the evolution aspects. By means of the PSA index it is possible to compare the structures of the males' and females' responses concerning the priorities of the Romanians in their life.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Bozga, Raluca Elisabeta; Baleanu, Daniela Nicoleta
Article Title: The Evolution of the Romanian Drug Industry - Past and Present
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: drug industry; evolution; market
Abstract: The drug, medicine or pharmaceutical industry is a branch of the chemical industry producing organic synthesis substances or bio-derived products useful in human health care. The purpose of this work is to analyze the evolution of the drug industry in Romania, since the appearance of the first production units up to present days. The main changes in this sector are investigated: starting businesses, development of their product portfolio etc. Data are presented chronologically, giving details regarding the production structures and the main Romanian producers before 1989, the transformations induced in this industry by the political and economic changes that occurred in Romania after 1989 (the evolution of older companies, the creation of new companies, data regarding the evolution of the drugs market and the main competitors).

Authors: Radovic, M; Brnjas, Z; Vulicevic, V
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Radovic, Mirjana; Brnjas, Zvonko; Vulicevic, Vukica
Article Title: Elaboration of the Importance of Fast-Growing Companies Gazelles - New Evidence from Serbia
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: Growth; Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs); Gazelles; Business Performance; Innovations
Abstract: In this paper, attention is focused on the specific segment of small and medium-sized firms, characterized by rapid and stable growth, their ability to quickly adapt to changing market conditions and in the long term to operate at the high-performance level. These companies are today known as Gazelles, a term that was coined by an American author, David Birch (Birch D. L., The Job Generation Process, M.I.T. Program on Neighborhood and Regional Change, 1979). The paper deals with issues such as definitions and basic characteristics of these companies, the key factors of their business, as well as their level of development in the European Union and the Republic of Serbia. The variety of research methods has been used in accordance with the specifics and the complexity of the case analysis, relying on the relevant domestic and international literature and internet sources. The results of the research clearly show that, with consistent support from economic policy, Gazelles can make an important contribution to solving the comprehensive socio-economic crisis we are facing in today's modern societies.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Stefanova, Julia S.; Wenner, Zachary K.
Article Title: Bulgaria's Capital Market Integration into the European Union
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES, PT 1
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: capital market integration; stock exchange
Keywords Plus: STOCK MARKETS
Abstract: The Bulgarian capital market remains limited in size and insufficiently developed relative to Eurozone countries and Central and Eastern European (CEE) member states. To redress an array of market deficiencies and structural shortfalls, the European Union (EU) and Bulgarian government entities have collaboratively sought to catalyze market development through enhanced capital market integration. The research evaluates the scope of EU and Bulgarian market interventions, the factors related to the nascence of Bulgaria's capital market and the extent of capital market integration. Through statistical evaluation of price-based indicators for financial integration, the research analyzes alignment between Bulgaria's capital market and those of the Eurozone and regional countries. These findings are based on correlation analysis and parametric hypothesis testing with respect to the existence of integration dependencies. Through empirical analysis, the report evaluates the integration of the government securities market, the stock market and the banking market and indicates the determinants with the greatest influence on the development of the Bulgarian stock market.

Authors: Toma, SG; Marinescu, P; Constantin, I
Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Toma, Sorin-George; Marinescu, Paul; Constantin, Ionut
Article Title: Entrepreneurship and Economic Growth
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: entrepreneurship; economic growth; global entrepreneurship index; gross domestic product
Abstract: Countries compete not only for markets, human resources, technology or investments, but also for growth and development in a very dynamic economic environment. Economic growth has always constituted a leading concern for governments, policymakers, and researchers. There is a broad consensus around the necessity of a growth-oriented economic policy in all countries of the world. The paper builds on a vast body of literature that highlights the importance of economic growth in a highly competitive global environment and the various ways entrepreneurship may contribute to growth. The main objectives of this research are to briefly define the concepts of entrepreneurship and economic growth, and to emphasize their relationship. The methodology is based on a quantitative research. The paper shows that entrepreneurship and economic growth represent two multidimensional and interconnected concepts.

Book Editors: Chivu, L; Ciutacu, C; IoanFranc, V; Andrei, JV
Author Full Names: Gaf-Deac, Joan, I; Ciutacu, Otilia Teodora
Article Title: Agglomeration Economies in Mountain Areas: Multi-Storeyed Montain Concentration in North-Eastern Romania
Source Title: ISSUES AND INNOVATIVE TRENDS IN SUSTAINABLE GROWTH - STRATEGY CHALLENGES FOR ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL POLICIES (ESPERA 2016), PT 2
Conference Title: 4th International Conference on Economic Scientific Research - Theoretical, Empirical and Practical Approaches (ESPERA)
Author Keywords: comparative advantage; competitive advantage; economic mountainous agglomeration; spatial distribution companies
Keywords Plus: DIVERSITY
Abstract: Mountain economic productive activities inevitably are distributed in space. Economic policies, technologies and businesses in mountain areas target specific elements and induce spatial determinants, hosting geo-storeyed mountain economic productive activities. Location on a floor or other spatial positioning marks the profile of agro-mountain company. Inevitably, economic mountainous agglomeration occurs, since like in any case, perfectly symmetrical distribution of specific locations cannot be recorded. Overcrowding is characterized by levels of aggregation. The stairs are differentiated on heights of geographical/subgeographical agglomeration, but essentially become dependent on externalities for business opportunities. You may find spatial distribution gradients of firms in a multistage mountain cluster. In a mountainous region, in our opinion, it is imperative to engender innovation spots. It appears that in the mountainous region capable of hosting a geo-multi-storied business infrastructure, as in northeastern Romania, there are some cumulative mechanisms, with which productive activities foodservice can be crowded: Considering crowding as a self-consolidating economic zone or concerned mountain region, it is possible to identify thereof rational aspects as, the waste, dissipation, spread, disarticulation or desegregation equally lead to weakening economic zone or region under certain circumstances or de-localization effects.
